ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I recommend this course to the other students.
It is a nice introduction to quantum mechanics but one should try and go beyond it.

I would certainly recommend this course and tell them that you will enjoy yourself. While we all had a quantum mechanics class that covered much of this material as undergraduates, it is absolutely amazing how much better I feel that I understand quantum mechanics now.
Phys 508 is a core course for every students who seriously think about physics.
I would recommend taking quantum mechanics

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: it has certainly deepen my knowledge!
I would have liked deeper discussions and more advanced techniques for my research.

I did learn a lot about Lie algebras and ways of looking at Quantum Mechanics apart from solving the Schrodinger equations using Diff. Eq. methods. Overall though, I felt like I gained more practical quantum mechanics knowledge in my undergraduate classes. I have a great respect for Dr. Iachello's knowledge of algebraic methods, but I feel like I could have learned more of the roots of quantum mechanics if these techniques were emphasized a little less and practical problem solving was emphasized some more.
It is a very fundamental course and will help me understand the concepts involved with my research in condensed matter.
